description.para: Grapple is an attempt to restrain someone. A normal brawl attack is made, at a -5 penalty. Success means that the defender has been grabbed. A second roll is immediately made to see if the attacker can keep hold of the defender.

Both attacker and defender roll
strength brawl
though the defender has the option of using agility instead of strength. If the attacker is again successful, then both opponents are grappling. Whilst grappling, neither can move, and both suffer a -10 penalty per point of reach of any weapon that is used. Neither can use a shield.

Either opponent can try to break the grapple on an attack action, by using opposed agility/brawl as above. The person trying to break the grapple always has the option of using either strength or agility.
A grappled character can only defend against attacks by the person who has grappled them. Both can use attack actions to attack each other as normal.

A brawling attack is made at -10, success means that a damage roll is made, plus there is a chance that the defender is knocked from their feet. The attacker makes a second brawl attack immediately, using strength instead of agility. The defender defends with either strength or agility, and uses either athletics or brawl to try and remain standing.

Success on the part of the attacker means that the defender is unsteady. A good success means that they are prone. The defender gets a bonus of +10 for each leg beyond two that they have (and -10 if they have only one leg). Penalties for being lame also apply.
If opponents are grappling each other, a trip attempt gets a +5 bonus, but the attacker goes down with the defender unless a superb success is achieved.

A slow attack at -5, success results in a temporary hold, as if the defender has been grappled. Immediately after success, both attacker and defender make oppossed brawl checks, with the defender able to choose between using strength or agility. Success for the attacker leaves the defender unsteady, whilst a good success will leave them prone, and can optionally cause stun damage as well - the attacke makes a damage roll as normal.
An excellent success enables the attacker to place the defender wherever they want, within 2m of the attacker.

This manouevre allows the attacker to disarm their foe, removing the defender's weapon from their hand. An attack is made at -10. Success means that the defender cannot attack with that weapon that round (if their action has already occured this round, then they suffer no penalty).
The defender has the choice of oppossed strength or dexterity skill checks. If the attack wins, then the defender has been disarmed.
This manouevre is intended to force the defender off their guard, allowing a follow up strike at greater effectiveness.
Bash with the shield.
Kill someone with a single blow. Slow attack, -15 to hit. Size x stamina roll of 15 + 5 x wounds or die.
Halves armour. Slow attack, -10 to hit.
Bare handed attack which does mixed damage, adding brawl skill to the damage rolled.

When initiated against someone who is not expecting an attack (any attack, so cannot be done against someone in combat, even if they are fighting someone else), then an ambush ignores all armour. If Killing Blow or Deadly punch is known, then they may be combined with the ambush.
Ambush is a slow attack.
The attack can attack twice, each time at a -15 penalty to skill. The first attack is fast, the second attack is slow, but both happen at the same initiative.
This does not affect defence, but no other manouevre can be combined with this.
The attack can attack three times, each time at a -30 penalty to skill. The first attack is fast, the second attack is normal, and the third attack is slow.
This does not affect defence, but no other manouevre can be combined with this.
